bill_title: restrict the use of fireworks that frighten livestock or leave debris on private property.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to restrict the use of fireworks that frighten livestock or leave debris on private property. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 34-37 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: The governing body of a county, for areas outside the boundaries of a municipality, may adopt an ordinance that prohibits any person from discharging or using fireworks from any public street, road, or right-of-way in such a manner as to cause debris from the fireworks to fall onto private property, or result in noise or explosions that disturb or frighten livestock on the private property, without the permission of the property owner. 170 copies were printed on recycled paper by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.098 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

action_log.status_text: First read in Senate and referred to
